chargeHist.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse or Child Abuse Injunction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Allen Marten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.  If revoked the defendant has 2 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1 and Ct 2 and Ct 3 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court.  Defendant granted payment plan of $25.00 per month to begin 07/01/2022.Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.
Defendant is not to possess any firearms or guns.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request   Defendant is to undergo a Domestic Abuse Assessment and follow through with any recommendations
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence is stayed until further Court order.  Jail sentence is only on Ct 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Allen Marten

records.addlTxt: 9:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Ellen Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy Allen Marten in court.  Attorney Christine Kuczynski in court for Timothy Allen Marten. An agreement has been reached.  The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered his plea, knowingly, intelligently and of his own free will and finds the defendant Guilty.   State is in compliance with victim rights law.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2022 at 09:40 am.

04:17 PM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Timothy Allen Marten, appeared by phone with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:40 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 24, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on April 12, 2022 at 04:10 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with  T.K.M. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not be in the presence or possession of drugs or drug paraphernalia, or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a licensed Wisconsin medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is not to possess any firearms.

10:48 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Timothy Allen Marten, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 02:40 pm.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 04:10 pm.
